newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sakakibara says does not comment on forex moves.
newsitem.headline: Sakakibara says does not comment on forex moves.

text.p: Eisuke Sakakibara, Japan's Vice Finance Minister for International Affairs, said on Tuesday that he makes no comments on exchange rates or any rumours in the currency markets.
Sakakibara told Reuters: "I do not have any comments on foreign exchange moves. I do not make any comments on any rumours in the forex market."
Talk has circulated in the market since late last week that the Finance Ministry warned currency traders not to buy dollars above 119 yen.
The dollar was holding steady against the yen at about 118.40 yen at midday on Tuesday.
